meanings.definition: A graft of tissue between individuals that are genetically identical.
meanings.sent1: The doctor performed an isograft to replace the damaged tissue.
meanings.sent2: The isograft was successful because the twins shared the same genes.
meanings.sent3: The isograft between the identical twins was like a perfect match puzzle piece.
meanings.sent4: The isograft acted like a clone, seamlessly integrating into the recipient's body.
meanings.sent5: The isograft created a harmonious bond between the siblings' tissues.

meanings.definition: To transplant tissue from one individual to another who is genetically identical.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon will isograft skin from the donor to the recipient.
meanings.sent2: They isograft organs to save lives in cases of severe illness.
meanings.sent3: I will isograft the flower from one pot to another to help it grow better.
meanings.sent4: She isografted knowledge from her friend's experience to improve her skills.
meanings.sent5: The farmer isografts branches to create a stronger, healthier tree.
